creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
markings:
each page showing the scene of special products being made;
Making Wooden Bowls at Nikko(Nikko zenwan)
Stone Bridge at Fukui in Echizen Province(Echizen Fukui ishibashi)
Paper Making at Echizen(Echizen ho_sho-gami)
Making Camphor(Sho_no_ seiho_)
Fishing Heike Crab at Sanuki(Sanuki Heike-gani)
Charcoal Making at Ikeda(Ikeda sumi)
Gathering Seashells at Sumiyoshi Beach(Sumiyoshi-ura shiohi)
Making Nives at Sakai(Sakai ho_cho_)
Making Laver at Asakusa in Edo(Edo Asakusa nori)
Weaving Factory at Nishijin in Kyo_to(Kyo_ Nishijin oriya)
Making Lacquer(Urushi no seiho_)
Candy Shop at Hirano(Furikiri? Hirano ame)
Drying Turnips at Tenno_ji(Tenno_ji hoshi kabura)
Water Imps at Bungo Province(Bungo no kawataro_)
Tile-Makers in O_saka(O_saka Kawara-ya machi kawara-shi)
Salt Garden(Shio-hama)
Brown Sugar Making at O_shima in Satsuma Province(Satsuma O_shima kuro-zato_)
Rice Market at Kominato, O_saka(O_saka Kominato kome-ichi)
Making Wax(Sarashi ro_)
medium: Woodblock printed book; ink on paper
title: Famous Products from Mountain and Sea vol. 3
